title: Social Security goes after overpayments, reversing Biden policy
description: Under the Biden administration last year, the agency reduced the amount of overpayments that Social Security would recoup to just 10% of any one paycheck.

title: Terry Real ‚Äì Breaking the Rules of Traditional Couples Therapy for Superior Results, A Few Frameworks That Work (#798)
description: I‚Äôm featuring five chapters from the audiobook¬†Fierce Intimacy¬†by¬†Terry Real.¬†What you will hear in this episode will help you identify both your and your partner‚Äôs losing strategies in relationships, and help you move from disharmony to repair. Terry is the creator of Relational Life Therapy, or RLT, which underpins all his books, courses, and teachings and equips people with the powerful relational skills they need to make love work.¬†He is also the author of five books, including the¬†New York Times¬†bestseller¬†Us: Getting Past You and Me to Build a More Loving Relationship.¬† The post Terry Real ‚Äì Breaking the Rules of Traditional Couples Therapy for Superior Results, A Few Frameworks That Work (#798) appeared first on The Blog of Author Tim Ferriss.

title: #2273 What happened to our partnership?
description: Before I partnered with Jesse Pujji, we were buddy-buddy. Texting all the time. When we got started, we got excited about the world of possibilities for our company. Now? Something is missing. I asked him about it. And about where he put his money, why he‚Äôs not launching more companies now, what he‚Äôs building with AI, and more. Jesse Pujji is the founder of Gateway X, the venture studio. Jesse & Andrew are building Bootstrapped Giants, a resource for ambitious, unfunded founders. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: #2272 Aux: >$10mil advising private equity
description: When Kasey Grelle heard that private equity companies paid marketing agencies to evaluate companies they wanted to buy, she spotted a business opportunity. That realization became Aux Insights, the firm that‚Äôs become ‚Äúthe office of the CMO‚Äù for private equity companies. Listen to how they got clients & built their business. Kasey is a former reporter who founded Aux Insights, a global advisory firm that acts as the office of the CMO for private equity firms, specializing in digital growth strategy and marketing diligence. When she‚Äôs not scaling businesses, she‚Äôs up before dawn at 4 AM, savoring the quiet magic of early morning work before the chaos of her three-kid household kicks in. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint

title: Tesla shares have declined every week since Elon Musk went to Washington
description: Tesla's stock has dropped for seven straight weeks, a stretch that dates back to the beginning of Donald Trump's second term in the White House.

title: China to impose retaliatory tariffs on some Canadian products as trade war heats up
description: China on Saturday announced retaliatory tariffs on Canadian agricultural goods, hitting back after Ottawa slapped import duties on Chinese-made EVs.

title: Stop Multitasking and Try Timeboxing
description: There are all kinds of productivity tools out there promising to help you make the most of your day. Some people swear by timeboxing: the method of reserving time on your calendar each day for each task you want to get done, and then truly focusing on that one thing at a time. The return on merging your to-do list with your calendar like this, says Marc Zao-Sanders, is higher productivity, better collaboration, and less distraction and anxiety. He explains how try to the method yourself and the how your team and organization benefit from it, not just you. Zao-Sanders is author of the book "Timeboxing: The Power of Doing One Thing at a Time."

title: How Leaders Can Encourage Learning
description: In¬†an age of rapidly changing technology,¬†it‚Äôs¬†more important than ever for organizations to effectively support employee learning.¬†Gianpiero Petriglieri, associate professor at INSEAD, has studied leaders who do this well and says they fall into¬†three¬†categories:¬†custodians, challengers,¬†or¬†connectors. He explains¬†which¬†type¬†of learning leader works best in which contexts and how all three approaches can help individuals and teams¬†reach the next level. Petriglieri is author of the HBR article "Three Ways to Lead Learning."

title: Concurrent Gainers: 7 stocks that gained for 5 days in a row
description: In the five trading sessions prior to March 7, the Sensex rose by around 1.5%, or 1,134 points, closing at 74,333. The market ended on a positive note in 2 of those five sessions. ETMarkets highlighted seven stocks from the BSE 100 index that consistently saw price gains during this period. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

title: FPIs sell Rs 24,753 crore in March amid market jitters, but outflows slow down
description: FPIs have been selling off Indian equities in March, with outflows totalling Rs 24,753 crore as of March 7. The trend has slowed slightly, but cumulative outflows for 2025 have reached over Rs 1.30 lakh crore. Chinese equities' strong performance and global uncertainties are key factors influencing the FPI movement.

title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYC‚Äôs Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. Get the Side Hustle Ideas Database: https://clickhubspot.com/ogv
author: HubSpot

title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.
author: HubSpot

title: Agency Growth Starts with Existing Clients
description: Agency growth consultant, author, and podcast host Max Traylor discusses how marketing agencies can dramatically increase profitability by focusing on existing client relationships rather than constantly chasing new business. Max shared strategies for improving client retention through smarter pricing models and positioning your agency as a true marketing leader for clients. This insightful discussion offers practical guidance for agency owners looking to future-proof their business model and significantly boost their bottom line without the endless hustle for new clients. Speaking on the intersection of targeted advertising and organic engagement, he reveals how brands can authentically connect with niche audiences on Reddit's unique platform. title: Advice Line with Alberto Perlman of Zumba
description: Zumba co-founder and CEO Alberto Perlman joins Guy on the Advice Line, where they answer questions from three early-stage founders. Plus, Alberto‚Äôs take on the value of partnerships for growing brands ‚Äî and why entrepreneurs should say ‚Äòyes‚Äô more often.First we meet Stefanie in Michigan, who‚Äôs looking for the smartest route to raise capital for her non-slip workout shoes. Then Jack in New Hampshire, who wants to broaden the appeal of his protein powders for sensitive stomachs. And Peter in Colorado, who needs help evaluating which opportunities to chase for his plant-based ski wax.Thank you to the founders of Barreletics, Drink Wholesome, and mountainFLOW for being a part of our show.If you‚Äôd like to be featured on a future Advice Line episode, leave us a one-minute message that tells us about your business and a specific question you‚Äôd like answered. Send a voice memo to hibt@id.wondery.com or call 1-800-433-1298.And be sure to listen to Zumba‚Äôs founding story as told by Alberto and his co-founder Beto on the show in 2017.This episode was produced by Sam Paulson with music by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by John Isabella. title: PayPal: Max Levchin (June 2022)
description: During its formative years in the late 1990's, Paypal attracted an extraordinary group of young entrepreneurs, who then went on to build some of the best known companies in tech.¬†They became known as The PayPal Mafia‚Äîand Max Levchin was one of the leaders.¬†A computer genius from Soviet Ukraine, Max joined Peter Thiel, Elon Musk, Reid Hoffman and¬†others as they grew PayPal into a massively successful online payment service.¬†Along the way, they encountered almost every start-up challenge imaginable, including the emotional ouster of Elon Musk as CEO.¬†After PayPal was acquired by eBay in 2002, Max couldn't sit still, so he launched a startup lab that eventually led to another successful fintech company: Affirm.This episode was produced by Alex Cheng with music by Ramtin Arablouei. Edited by Neva Grant, with research from Claire Murashima.You can follow HIBT on¬†X¬†&¬†Instagram, and email us at¬†hibt@id.wondery.com.
